description: Principal Product Manager - Technical, Traffic Measurement - Job ID: 3149439 | Amazon.jobs Skip to main content × Home Teams Locations Job categories My career My applications My profile Account security Settings Sign out Resources Accommodations Benefits Inclusive experiences How We Hire Leadership principles Working at Amazon FAQ Principal Product Manager - Technical, Traffic Measurement Job ID: 3149439 | Amazon.com Services LLC Apply now Description Amazon Advertising operates at the intersection of eCommerce and advertising, offering a rich array of digital advertising solutions with the goal of helping our customers find and discover anything they want to buy. We help advertisers reach Amazon customers on Amazon.com, across our other owned and operated sites, on other high quality sites across the web, and on millions of Kindles, tablets, and mobile devices. We start with the customer and work backwards in everything we do, including advertising. If you’re interested in joining a rapidly growing team working to build a unique, world-class advertising group with a relentless focus on the customer, you’ve come to the right place. We are looking for a Principal Product Manager - Technical (PM-T) to lead an across-advertising product that will have significant strategic impacts to Amazon advertising business that build customer trust in Amazon Advertising media measurement and confidence in making marketing and financial decisions. You will work closely with ad product owners and advertisers deeply understand needs of customers, use that information to define customer experience of ad measurement and reporting, and develop multi-year roadmaps that will lead to success for customers globally using our measurement products. This opportunity requires deep knowledge on advertising business and industry measurement standards (e.g., MRC), strong analytical and communication skills. · You will set the vision, define the use cases and the product requirements for Amazon advertising measurement. · You define a long-term roadmap, and drive teams to execute on your vision. You own customer engagement and take point on product reliability issues impacting customers. · You will use your product manager toolkit to conduct market research, competitive analysis, analyze customer data and conduct direct communication with customers to drive the vision and make informed roadmap decisions. · You identify and proactively manage areas of business importance related to your product(s): customer value, market opportunity, financial and legal compliance, endemic product architecture problems, builder resourcing, and any other large risks. · You partner effectively with other leaders involved in the design, development, marketing, and sale of your product(s). You are able to influence their roadmap priorities and reach consensus on approach/prioritization. · You design product value propositions and communications for large audiences, PR, Legal, Marketing, and Sales. Basic Qualifications - 2+ years of end to end product delivery experience - 8+ years of technical product or program management experience - Bachelor's degree - Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product - Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition - Experience leading engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product - Experience technical product management Preferred Qualifications - Experience working directly with Engineers on product enhancements - Experience in project management methodologies, business analysis, or process improvement Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status. Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner. Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $161,900/year in our lowest geographic market up to $279,900/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. title: Tririga Infrastructure Engineer, Close Systems
description: Tririga Infrastructure Engineer, Close Systems - Job ID: 2804073 | Amazon.jobs Skip to main content × Home Teams Locations Job categories My career My applications My profile Account security Settings Sign out Resources Accommodations Benefits Inclusive experiences How We Hire Leadership principles Working at Amazon FAQ Tririga Infrastructure Engineer, Close Systems Job ID: 2804073 | ADCI HYD 13 SEZ Apply now Description Are you interested in building high-performance, globally scalable Financial systems that support Amazon's current and future growth? Are you seeking an environment where you can drive innovation? Does the prospect of working with top engineering talent get you charged up? If so, Amazon Finance Technology (FinTech) is for you.We have a team culture that encourages innovation and we expect developers to take a high level of ownership for the product vision, technical architecture,build a scalable,service-oriented platform and continuously innovate on behalf of our customers. FinTech systems process large scale data sets eliminating several thousand hours of manual work for global Accounting and Finance teams. Our systems leverage the latest technologies from the AWS stack providing engineers an amazing opportunity to learn and grow. We are looking for an Applications Engineer - Tririga to design, implement, maintain, and optimize the infrastructure supporting Tririga solutions across business functions for large businesses. The Engineer will work across Amazon engineering and business teams, in planning, designing, executing and implementing solutions across the globe. Our systems process large scale data sets eliminating several thousand hours of manual work for global Lease Administration, Lease Accounting and Finance teams. Key job responsibilities Tririga Configuration and Customization,Automate maintenance tasks,System Performance Monitoring and Optimization for enhanced customer experience,Security compliance and patching.Create plans for platform and application upgrades from 4.2/11.2 to next versions.Work on Engineering Excellence initiatives like Design Disaster Recovery setup with optimal RPO and RTO.Work on Operational Engineering excellence initiatives to ensure 24/7 system availability to customers.Leverage AWS tech stack to design scalable system architecture. Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field. Must have atleast 5 years of experience in designing, upgrading, troubleshooting, and optimizing on-prem Linux based infrastructures for Tririga environments across business functions for large business. At least 5 years of overall experience in administering enterprise applications on Linux operating systems,administering java based enterprise applications using Websphere or Weblogic. At least 3 years of overall experience in managing AWS resources like VPC, EC2, EBS, S3, RDS, Route53, ACM, Cloud Watch, and CDK pipelines. At least 3 years of overall experience in managing SSO/MFA technologies like SAML Federation and SSL certificates. At least 5 years of overall experience in using shell scripting or PowerShell and automation of repetitive maintenance tasks, patching, alerting,monitoring, and log management. Good understanding of JVM output logs, JVM Options and JVM exceptions. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Preferred Qualifications Experience in building integrations between Tango,Tririga and General Ledger. Preferred to have experience in AWS services like AWS Glue,Lambda,S3,SNS,SQS,API Gateway,Cloud Watch,Quick Sight.
